40D64E06B48E4671ADDCE46914331103.description: Investigate scholarship, study and work opportunities available to German-speaking students in Saskatchewan.

8DB5621439814A33832BF5E34C3FADA2.description: Research opportunities to further personal German language learning in Saskatchewan (e.g., post-secondary German courses, online courses and community language learning centres).

62FED0687CF840E8938B9ADA5D71FE2F.description: Explore German cultural associations in Saskatchewan such as the Saskatchewan Association of Teachers of German (SATG), the Saskatchewan Organization of Heritage Languages (SOHL), Heritage Language Schools (e.g., Das Schulhaus and the Saskatoon German Language Heritage School) and the Saskatchewan German Council.

E81357761CAE40119DE614773EAEE59E.description: Seek opportunities to communicate in German at the provincial level (e.g., German Saskatchewan social media groups, provincial German language newsletters, local German community radio and podcasts and corresponding in German with students from another Saskatchewan school).

B583EAD0DF064BDAACB6E01EE3F4695A.description: Describe benefits of being bilingual or plurilingual.

231238D4E23B41B7BCA11E7F8FF0B5A0.description: Reflect on personal experience with language (e.g., languages spoken, language learning history, family and heritage languages).

7635C1404E8547F8A5B009A37EDC16F4.description: Investigate opportunities in Saskatchewan to use and develop German language skills and explore personal identity as a German language learner.

2741E19E74354188B144131DBB4CE96A.description: Compare historical and contemporary reasons for the immigration of German-speaking people to Saskatchewan.

44D05372F18B4B4998D8F30EC5056656.description: Inquire about German-speaking culture and heritage (e.g., the arts, celebrations, community, traditions, language, history and food) in Saskatchewan by: interviewing members of the German-speaking community in Saskatchewan; researching Saskatchewan organizations, festivals and events (e.g., Mosaic, Folkfest, Multilingual Association, Multicultural Council of Saskatchewan and Saskatchewan Organization for Heritage Languages); and, participating in activities related to German culture in Saskatchewan.

D1E13FBA1B7F490AA540290627EC010B.description: Research the contributions (e.g., schnitzel, sauerkraut, Schwarzwälderkirschtorte and Black Forest torte) of cultural and religious heritages (e.g., Hutterian, Mennonite and Lutheran) in Saskatchewan with roots in German-speaking cultures.

B6393F9AC90143D199C770BB9931EE20.description: Investigate common products (e.g., Red Bull, Rolex and Porsche) from German-speaking countries.

4A4D6FE7C4AB4F48AF0DC30623AE4758.description: Determine how direct and extended family members are addressed in German culture.

66EE328B5E964C21A89A114DDE40CA6E.description: Practise pronouncing traditional German surnames (e.g., Schmidt and Müller).

9BB873F35DD24A9D970FD3EBCEB321A2.description: Identify towns and places (e.g., Muenster, Langenburg and Neuanlage) in Saskatchewan that have German names.

F7FA834A8D4C4714B46FD8BA6F8F96E8.description: Explore the concept of language minority communities in Saskatchewan.

C36A27CF43D842C4867B8A282772C439.description: Discuss the relationship between the language and cultures of German-speaking peoples.

A2CCA66E3E1C4D5C9A9C16851CD3C28F.description: Explore historical and contemporary elements, and the cultural and linguistic diversity, of German cultures in Saskatchewan.

315C04F27FEF4600B540DBDF8D7CFD9F.description: Narrate descriptions of personal lived experiences or activities.

DEA11344F9234AA592B3A98CF02B0AF2.description: Experiment with communicating messages in a variety of written formats (e.g., notes, lists, paragraphs, graphs, emails, blogs and text messages).

E722C214D15B4AB1A6450A6AA1A733D9.description: Provide basic written directions to a place using imperative sentences (e.g., “Gehen Sie nach links in der Hauptstraße, und dann geradeaus, bis Sie zum Rathaus kommen”).

9D160757EF75489DA99CD2442E2D3B4E.description: Communicate messages about time with reference to 12-hour and 24-hour clocks.

B95B11AC21204781B8D2A15FC79FCA5C.description: Create simple social media posts using basic vocabulary.

340336B1B2A145CF9AFAB17F32BE2F75.description: Compose a greeting card (e.g., birthday) using simple expressions.

633323474EDB4FD0A2B60CB1AB95959D.description: Complete an application form in German with basic personal information (e.g., name, gender, telephone number and address).

1BFE80BE37A44DB7AB10C9E3F75EA790.description: Communicate simple written expressions (e.g., yes, no, please, thank you, excuse me and sorry).

3EFB893A9B3741F08B12C0566BD5E1BD.description: Write to communicate meaning about a variety of daily topics such as personal details (e.g., name and age), family members (e.g., number of siblings) and class schedule (e.g., teacher and subject).

A3B2A2555356478EAEE6E3901ED08E4F.description: Produce simple written German texts related to big ideas such as: German communities in Saskatchewan; daily routines; and, personal relationships.

AFEDFF6E56804AD38E17B291D0A607A7.description: Produce, with guidance, simple written German texts on familiar topics to express ideas, extend knowledge of the world, achieve objectives and for enjoyment.

D311F471503446CBADC8E41BDC549CBD.description: Use German for entertainment and personal enjoyment (e.g., express humour, perform skits or songs and create stories).

E1EB34A7686F423FB878ECDE58957FF6.description: Relate descriptions of personal lived experiences or activities.

1A8DBF32A95A4C5F88D61DB8D455DB29.description: Complete simple transactions in familiar contexts such as purchasing items in a store and ordering a meal from a menu.

519540987208420789CC16B50511F937.description: Communicate information about time in both 12-hour and 24-hour clock formats.

08465299372940F59E59351054713668.description: Employ imperative structure to provide basic step-by-step instructions in situations such as cooking and giving directions to a location.

F53553561A3B4B5BB4C96D3743C999FF.description: Convey opinions or personal perspectives on a given topic such as a movie or education.

B89EA916B2C34C9F80BCF136926F20D3.description: Express feelings and emotions using simple adjectives, facial expressions and body language.

09204335166544518EE127360D324027.description: Pose and respond to questions to generate conversations on familiar topics such as hobbies (e.g., “Was machst du in deiner Freizeit?”) and class schedules (e.g., “Was ist dein Stundenplan?”).

108953B3FF304477B2DC98916DD7B954.description: Respond appropriately to other speakers during structured conversations or discussion.

595515B6B2734E8F9010A5992E9A3B6F.description: Produce simple oral German texts related to big ideas such as: German communities in Saskatchewan; daily routines; and, personal relationships.

A4C3D1C8C17A4490A838D7AFA581A4D1.description: Produce, with guidance, simple oral German texts on familiar topics to express ideas, extend knowledge of the world, achieve objectives and for enjoyment.

3403D43365CB4CB18D452A3529A899B2.description: React to written texts with emotion (e.g., empathy, surprise, appreciation or disgust).

F51266378E8846B9B1E6BC6646EFD55A.description: Identify the following elements in written texts on familiar topics:  who or what is doing an action (i.e., subject); who or what is receiving the action (i.e., direct object); who is affected by the action (i.e., indirect object); and, to whom the indirect object is given.

6B39CB54CA0847E2947C5CF7BE5F5E9F.description: Interpret information about time in both 12-hour and 24-hour clock formats.

4CCF93A9BDEB487F8BE83CD28583F76E.description: Select from a provided list of options on a simple online survey regarding personal information (e.g., gender, occupation, nationality and age).

7B8DC3644E2644339456DD588C6352EE.description: Reiterate the basic directions of written imperative texts.

FA4986ED94CE4FF0A6917EE6AC668A9A.description: Retrieve important details (e.g., date, time, location and price) from mass media texts (e.g., posters, flyers and advertisements).

83BA3EE20E834E26B1EBD51C797A3004.description: Identify key information (e.g., location, date and time of an event) from personal texts (e.g., emails, text messages and cards).

3C742968CD83454AAC6677C434048DBB.description: Comprehend simple common signs in German (e.g., stop, keep right, parking, no smoking and washroom).

103CB1C9CA4D4E4D97E023DDB673C506.description: Read a variety of simple written German texts (e.g., comic books, news headlines and public signs) that address: German communities in Saskatchewan; daily routines; and, personal relationships.

030E41C5C5DF4797853BE436DD5229BB.description: Construct meaning, with guidance, of simple written non-fiction and fiction German texts on familiar topics to receive information, extend knowledge of the world, achieve objectives and for enjoyment.

7EFA78FE9C96467E90C6A60157F8B6CA.description: React to simple oral texts with emotion (e.g., empathy, surprise, appreciation or disgust).

2EF3A7839C5A4D06B5305ABB085780A2.description: Interpret simple conversations and respond appropriately to basic interactions, including: greetings and leave-taking; invitations; classroom instructions; requests for help; and, daily routines and activities.

5A1E37DAB1A94759AB2CB5788DAE208D.description: Summarize simple oral texts (e.g., weather reports and commercials).

B2BD42B5498E424E8749AC7FA7B72D56.description: Reiterate simple instructions in familiar contexts.

E0B1EB0625C0495A889EF86AC3EA7CED.description: Interpret information related to others’ personal details (e.g., name, age, address and nationality).

94315956987C497AA56E980965925740.description: Comprehend and respond to simple questions regarding personal details (e.g., name, age, address and telephone number).

2BA64F0851AB4C57AA4BC63A642A5C9D.description: Respond appropriately in structured interactions with common, simple, short phrases.

FB956EE8167143158ECDD2B1AC4C7D91.description: Listen to and view a variety of simple oral German texts (e.g., commercials, weather reports and cartoons) that address big ideas such as: German communities in Saskatchewan; daily routines; and, personal relationships.

C4063880BA3E4A6CB4D200C9BB5FA5CF.description: Construct meaning, with guidance, of simple oral non-fiction and fiction German texts on familiar topics to receive information, extend knowledge of the world, achieve objectives and for enjoyment.

8B2178B33C5A403387A66B98B0E187F9.description: Interpret meaning from common German gestures and expressions.

1FB6257437F94D149B29EC7E25AB893A.description: Recognize features of German words, including: possessive; negation; consonant clusters; and, long and short vowels.

49CB1AD8262943F78FBF69F383151C03.description: Identify the use of formal voice (e.g., “Sie” / “Ihnen” as the formal “you”).

9DFABC50DBD1432A97CDCBCA34C54D80.description: Interpret nuance expressed through present tense modal verbs (e.g., “I want to swim on Friday.” and “Ich will am Freitag schwimmen.”).

7CDEF07A6E5A4DE9ACB4E87F069E8534.description: Investigate generalized patterns for word order and verb conjugations.

B5D6B4A60A474A9EBCBBC81C21D8801D.description: Analyze the correlation of sound-letter elements.

2ADC002E3F2749F3A6F6D37648AF024C.description: Recognize conventions specific to German (e.g., capitalization of nouns, gender of nouns and placement of verb in the sentence).

8FA2D03405F74556AA8C36BE98EBD883.description: Identify related words in different forms (e.g., “Ich spiele” / “das Spiel” / “spielerisch”).

699B88D764EB4B1F80742C7D1B875FD6.description: Apply knowledge of simple prefixes (e.g., “ge-” for past perfect tense and “un-” for negation) and suffixes (e.g., “-lich”, “-ig” and “-heit”) to construct meaning.

18F0059072294EDBB26806A76D95B4FE.description: Comprehend simple context-appropriate vocabulary in personal texts and basic sight vocabulary (e.g., 250 basic words).

4E76569A3EEB453D9FE1B74580407663.description: Demonstrate, when interpreting oral and written texts, knowledge of German language concepts including basic context-specific vocabulary, word order and linguistic convention

5401CBAB116A4D60989C6C71943D5B34.description: Reflect, with guidance, on personal writing and speaking strategies.

6B0A7B7389F74186B0C1FD933300BC5B.description: Discuss challenges of learning to communicate in an additional language.

E5584AC34B7B4801AE157A1CC26462C2.description: Explain that risk-taking and a positive attitude are part of effective language learning.

A139093CD4A64F2EA8AA467A5C1A0925.description: Evaluate own written and oral productions.

77E4018EB4864A1493D946594B5C27A3.description: Use conventional phonemic awareness in pronunciation (e.g., the German “v” makes the same sound as the English “f”).

3E314385B9C046119343F658C3AD8EE5.description: Apply, with guidance, language learning strategies to support the production of oral and written text, such as: taking risks; using prior knowledge for personal expression in German; and, using physical (e.g., gestures and facial expressions) and auditory (e.g., laughter, tone and volume) cues to convey meaning.

4FFE05BF0C32402FABD38A30326DC0E7.description: Consult resources (e.g., peers and family, dictionaries, anchor charts and electronic applications) and visual aids (e.g., pictures, graphs and drawings) to support the production of oral and written texts.

DECB95EEC26143E29F7929E3FA09799B.description: Use tools such as graphic organizers and outlines to make a plan for speaking or writing.

AE6763A2B4154C91BA5EA14658FCA59E.description: Apply, with guidance, a variety of before, during and after strategies to communicate meaning when writing and speaking.

433625587CE14540B2ED8D39A94C4CAF.description: Use the German language for personal communication.

F693FF91D1884D2F8B43F897A6CAEAA3.description: Apply, with guidance, a variety of strategies to produce oral and written texts in German and reflect on personal language learning.

8CC99E2CCF4740B885D169BB286AC386.description: Reflect, with guidance, on personal viewing, listening and reading strategies.

6C47616CEABD40E1A2FBFC4FF4BBAA44.description: Discuss challenges of learning to interpret an additional language (e.g., tolerance of ambiguity).

DABFDF2C96AD4E55A031AD497FEEE58A.description: Apply, with guidance, language learning strategies such as: using supplementary information (e.g., summary, illustrations and background information); interpreting physical (e.g., gestures and facial expressions) and auditory (e.g., laughter, volume and tone) cues; examining context clues and key words; understanding of individual words to predict meaning of compound words; and, identify etymologically-related words by applying knowledge of English word order (e.g., “blau” = “blue” and is used in the same word order in both languages.

CB006A4EFDBA48DEBA1FCC37BA763F6C.description: Consult resources (e.g., peers and family, dictionaries, anchor charts and electronic applications) and visual aids (e.g., pictures, graphs and drawings) to help construct meaning of oral and written texts.

DD3E5FB5F1694B7488607A8F3C2C9CDC.description: Prepare to interpret oral and written texts using language learning strategies such as developing predictions and identifying purpose and context.

6CE83CB9A08A437FB4A1EA03D5E37515.description: Apply, with guidance, a variety of before, during and after language learning strategies to construct meaning when listening, viewing and reading.

E8005DD0212148FAAD1B53A71E1FE154.description: Apply, with guidance, a variety of strategies to interpret oral and written German texts and reflect on personal language learning.
